text:
Huge beer with intense malt favour (dark malts) and strong citrus hoppy finish.
Dark Red/Brownish color and aftertaste slight toasty, raisins and hoppy bitterness. 
The full body of the malt hits you first and the strong hoppy character follows. 
Not an easy beer! Very good

Aroma: 7/10 Apperance: 4/5 Taste:7/10 Palate:4/5 Overall: 15/20.

Aroma of caramel, fruits, wood, hay, chocolate and pine. Mahogany with a tan head. Medium sweet anm medium + bitter. Full body with a average to soft carbonation. Slightly dry and bitter finish. Overall a very plesant drink. Nice balance between the sweet tones of the special malts and the bitterness from the hops.

Lane z casku. Rubinowe, prawie czarne, jednak z wyraźnymi przebłyskami, raczej klarowne. Piany niewiele, po chwili praktycznie jej brak. Za to aromat cytrusów, żywicy i kwitnącej łąki uderza już z odległości. Bardzo intensywny i bardzo fajnie ułożony. W smaku z początku czuć ten chmielowy bukiet, jednak uzupełniony jest nutami biszkoptu i przypalonej skórki chleba. Goryczka średnia, bardzo fajnie wkomponowana i praktycznie brak wysycenia. Prawie idealnie trafiło w moje gusta.

Couleur rouge carmin du plus bel effet (même si on lorgne presque sur le brun), mousse beige qui tient bueno, nez agréable sur les agrumes qui virent finalement sur les fruits secs. En bouche on est sur des notes de raisins secs avec ce quil faut de caramel et de toffee. Lamertume est quant à elle plutôt légère. Ouaip, du coup on a plus limpression de se retrouver face à un Barley Wine light plutôt quà une véritable IPA. Pour le coup je dirais quon est hors style vis à vis de ce qui est écrit sur létiquette, mais ça reste bien sympa.

Wow, this is one massive beer. Bottle at The Swan, Broadway UK. Pours gorgeous dark Ruby red with a medium white head that dissipates. Aroma is dominated by the (Citra?) hops but the dark malts come through as toffee and raisins. Taste is an explosion of flavor. Slightly sweet but enough bitterness to balance. Citrus and stone fruit as well as dried fruits and toffee fill the mouth. Moderate carbonation and reasonable alcohol give a good palate. An exceptional beer, well worth a try if you can find it.

Keg at Old Red Cow, Smithfield, London, UK. It pours dark amber, with a medium, creamy, long lasting beige head. Aroma is malty, red berries, candy, caramel, toffee. Taste is medium bitter and light sweet. Body is medium, carbonation is fine. Overall not bad.

11.04.2017, 0,33l bottle @ home:
Big amber fizzy-creamy longlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet mineraly, roasted grain, leafs, soil, bark, old lawn, moss, hay, hops, pine needles, caramel, alcohol, hints of coffee. Taste is slightly dry mineraly, weeds, old leafs, minerals, paper, bark, roasted grain, soil, lawn, pine needles, hops, hints of caramel and coffee. Medium to longlasting bitterness, slightly watery and mineraly mouthfeel. Fair enough.
Bottle from the caley sample room. Pours dark black with chinks of red. Nose of roasted malts, red fruit, resin. Taste is balanced, malty, toast and marmite. Lovely.

Botella en 99Cervezas. 
Vierte en un más que inesperado color castaño oscuro (para ser una IPA), más bien turbio. No obstante, después de un rato compruebo que se trataba de turbidez por frío y que una vez atemperada muestra una gran transparencia y brillo en un bonito color caramelo. Espuma media de color vainilla y persistencia media-baja. 
Intensidad media en nariz, predominando las notas de lúpulo por encima de cualquier otra cosa. También algo de queso viejo y pimienta blanca, provenientes en principio también del lúpulo. Complejidad media-baja. 
En boca tenemos más lúpulo, con matices más ricos que en nariz, pero dominando por supuesto el sabor amargo aunque con una base de dulce que lo equilibra bastante bien. Un sabor muy agradable y conseguido. 
La persistencia es media y en boca evoluciona hacia un amargor ligeramente astringente y algo "polvoriento" que te deja la lengua más bien seca y que parece provenir en realidad de la malta torrefacta. Aparecen aquí también notas ligeras de café e incluso, después de un rato, algo de regaliz. Es de cuerpo medio y textura acre al inicio y más bien sedosa al final. 
Una cerveza inesperada y difícil de catalogar. No es exactamente una IPA, ni una Amber Ale o Red IPA. Casi parece una Brown Ale con lúpulo a capazos. Una cerveza original, muy interesante y que considero totalmente recomendable probar si se tiene ocasión.

Bottle, Oddbins West Hampstead. Deep ruddy brown, white foam. Solid enough amber, toasty malts, not super sweet, quite heavy pine bitterness. A style I like, this was nice, but somehow didnt stand out.
Aroma is candy/fruit, mild funk/sweetness and a hint of earthiness. The flavor is malts, candy/fruit, slight yeast funk and an earthy/spicy hop finish.

Beeroda.hu Beer Tasting Sessions @ Budapest. // 
Deep amber/red pour with small white head. Aroma of dark malts, dark berries and hops. Well balanced with sweet malts and great tasting juicy citrusy hops. Full of complex flavours. A really great experience.

Draught at Bootleggers Craft Beer Bar, Copenhagen. Hazy, amber-golden colour with a thin, white head. Fruity aroma with citrus, toasted notes, floral hops, biscuits, resins and caramel malts. Taste is bitter. Medium body with a creamy texture and a soft carbonation. Finishes dry and bitter with citrus fruits and caramel malts. Lovely.

The aroma of overripe fruit and some berries. Good taste of hops, nuts and bitterness. Good bitterness that fills the upper part of the mouth for a long time. Good beer. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
Brun/röd med stort ljusbrunt skum. Doftar och smakar mycket som en black ipa. Humligt frisk med tropisk frukt och lite karamellmalt

One of my fave breweries and my fave style. This will end well. Bottle at the Curlers Rest, Glasgow. Dark ruby, flat. Aroma of pine resin, crystal malt but also a funky soy-y note. The balance is more pronounced in the taste: the redcurrant sweetness is tempered with the slightest souring note. An explosion of flavour in the long bittersweet finish with digestive biscuit, strawberry liquorice, and a touch of medicinal herb. Very well carbonated. Neither my favourite Amber nor my favourite Siren brew, but thats setting the bar pretty high.

Lukt: Søtlig, noe vinaktig, honning, krydder malt.
Utseende: Brun.
Skum/kullsyre: Dekkende skum, heng langs kant.
Smak: Malt, eik, krydder.
Hvor: NMBCo, Sandnes.

Bottle. Dark reddish amber color, creamy reddish foam. Aroma: a little yeast, malt, yeast, spicy-fruity hops. Taste: juicy fruit and citrus, hops and caramel malt, pleasant and smooth hop bitterness.

Rather more thick and full than I had expected - not that I object to such a thing, though I had hoped to be refreshed, as I often am by a red. The beautiful deep ruby of this beers body is as alluring as was promised, I cant take my eyes off it, and the gingery brick-red head on it is equally pretty. I dont get as much citrus on the nose as I would like, the aroma was almost floral, lavender, which was a surprise. A bit of grapefruit on the tip of the tongue, but most of the taste is crystal biscuit and a boozy malbec flavour, with a bit of rather fun watermelon. A special beer indeed, but not what I had in mind for myself. Such is life.
Bottle. Deep amber color with small white head. Aroma - Caramel, pineapple, malt, red berries, choc. Taste - Sweet, citrus, caramel, grass, malt. Smooth.
Bottle from Waitrose. Pours murky dark brown with creamy head that leaves good lacing. Aroma treacle, raisin, earth and sprucey hops. Heavily bitter with a thick texture and lingering finish.

From tap at NMBC True North Bar with Sandnes kultur-people 12.01.17. Copper. Fine beige head and lacing. Aroma of dark malt, dark chocolate and rye bread. Similar and fine taste, balanced with pine and medium bitterness. Good drinkability

Aroma is dank kaolin, toasted bagel, fig newtons, golden raisins. Dark, clear, rusty brown beer with an impressive tan ice cream head. Way cool label, looks like one of those magic marker doodle art things. Chewy. Chalky roast, faint cocoa, slightly tannic, appreciable hops. Warming. Pretty good. ABC Liquors, Betton.
Bottle thanks to Leighton - pours reddish amber white head - nose/taste of sticky caramel, resin, tree sap, grapefruit peel - medium body
Draft. Short lasting white head, raisins and caramel in aroma, reddish dark brown colour. Tastes sweet and slightly sour, caramel, coffee. Very nice ale for slow sipping.

Keg Half Pint at Craft Beer Co, Clerkenwell, London in March 2014 - Deep Reddish Amber in colour. Foamy head. Excellent lacing. Malty; toasty/roasty biscuity malts, caramel. Hoppy; piney resinous hops. Fruity; grapefruit and tropical fruits. Spicy. Lovely malt/hop/fruit balance. Moderately bitter malty fruity throughout. Enjoyed this. Nice Red IPA! (2014-03-14)

Cask at The Earl Grey Inn, Leek. A brown colour with a medium off white head. Aroma of raisin, burnt caramel, grapefruit, orange, some pine, slight red berries, a little spice and subtle grassy hops. Taste of grapefruit, orange, pine, raisin, some burnt caramel, slight red berries, a little alcohol, a hint of toffee and subtle spicy, grassy hops. Medium bodied and a slick texture. A dry, citrusy, grassy hop bitterness in the finish. A hoppy amber ale with some very complex flavours. Sweet and fruity in the middle and thick on the mouthfeel. Very Interesting, the more I drink the better it gets.
Bottle from the importer. Highly carbonated amber, hoppy and malty sensations. good.
Bottle.Dark amber colour with medium head.Aroma is dried fruity and malty with flavor of caramel and chocolate,good burnt nut flavors and good taste of hops and rye bread.

Color marrón oscuro, rojizo si le da la luz, opaco, con capa de espuma marrón de dos dedos de grosor (buena retención). Carbonatación media. Aroma cítrico, a chocolate y caramelo. Sabor hiper complejo: según entra capto algo cítrico, a mitad de trago empiezo a captar una cantidad inmensa de chocolate (no entiendo que la mayoría de críticas no lo nombren, me parece demasiado evidente, quizá es que yo confundo chocolate con pasa quemada), y al tragarla queda chocolate amargo en boca. Incluso diría que hay notas de café, pero no estoy seguro. Hay mucho más en aroma y en sabor, pero soy incapaz de captar más. Me parece una auténtica maravilla. Una de las cervezas más complejas y mejor realizadas que he probado en mi vida. Red IPA o Amber Ale... Poco importa. Para repetir una y mil veces.
One of the best amber ales around, a well rounded soft, caramel like flavors with a strong grassy finish, love it.

Butelka 500ml. Ciemno-miedziany kolor przechodzacy w mahoniowe refleksy. Piana raczej mala lekko palona,zanika szybko. Dominuja nuty karmelowe z pieczywem i biszkoptami. Lekkie cytrusy w tle niezle wspolgraja z melasa i karmelem. Ciekawy goryczkowy finisz.

Sortfarvet og ufiltreret Amber Ale med mindre moccafarvet skumtop på 1/2 cm, som svinder til kant og overflade. 
Indledningsvis en let frugtagtig aroma med noter af tørret frugt, såsom rosiner. Lidt citron-noter, men ikke specielt genkendelig og tydelig. Senere åbner der sig en bedre og mere tydelig aroma af malt og frugt. 
Ganske mørk smag af ristet malt og humlebitterhed. Indledningsvis med lette søde smagsnoter af frugt, hvorefter en middel til solid humlebitterhed overtager helt, og øllet fremstår noget ubalanceret. Aftempereringen gør dog kun godt for dette bryg, og balancen samt meningen med det hele fremstår tydeligere. 
Mundfølelsen er blød, og øllet karboneret under middel niveau. Konsistensen er olieret, afslutningen bitter, let tør og kort. 
Overall: Brygget mangler i starten balance IMO og virker ucharmerende med en ubehagelig bitterhedsdominans. Bliver dog mere rund og ganske "spiselig" med tiden, så skibet kommer i land.
40 cl på fad, 5.8 % ABV, nydt på Kompasset på Østerbrogade 103. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma has dark malts with burned caramel and chocolate yet hoppy with grass, straw and some citrus. Taste is malty up front with dark malt, caramel and chocolate and is hoppy with grass, hay and citrus notes and finishes off with malt and a dry hoppy bitterness.

330 ml bottle bought at ICBeer in Kwun Tong.
Looks: Translucent deep copper brown colour with a layer of yeast sediments; One-quarter head and beige foam which fades in 30 seconds; Excellent sticky lacing with near zero carbonation.

Aroma: Fragrant amber malt, with strong grapefruit, shades of peaches, caramel, light toffee, light dark fruits, floral, molasses, pine, light resin, dry biscuits, yeast, strong lemon and very strong grass.

Taste: Close to medium sweet rich Amber malt, with grapefruits, caramel, burnt toast, tartness, light toffee, floral, fair molasses, pine, resin, spices, very dry biscuits, lemon, quite strong bitter hops and very strong grass. Very nice!

Body: Close to full body. Very slick palate.

Mouth Feel: Strong Amber maltyness in a solid and slick background with small degree of wheaty tartness. Loads of grapefruit bitter hops, combined well with burnt toast and caramel. Floral with fair molasses sweetness, distinctive resin ooze and pine. Very dry biscuity and yeasty with strong lemon to round. Sharp and colorful!

Hoppiness: Strong grapefruit, light peaches, floral, pine, light resin, strong lemon and strong grass in nose, same in taste with spices.
Bitterness is close to strong for a lasting, high astringent citrus malty finish.

After Taste: Very dry. Toasty fruity and strong bitter to mouth.

Comments: This is a strong Amber Ale with an attitude  strong grapefruit hoppiness, rich toasty maltyness with burnt and light dark fruity flavors, and ended with just-right pine, ooze and strong grass. Quality staff to savor. Highly recommended!

Pours very dark amber, hazy. Giant mountain of foamy tan head. Not all that much aroma, which is not so surprising given that Im trying to smell it through three inches of head. Flavor is a bit nutty, with maybe some nearly-burnt toast and red fruit notes. I dont get all that much IPA here, though the finish is somewhat bitter.

Very dark red with complex tan head with bubbles like soda. Head dampens the aroma. Flavor is of toasted....something, a little bit burnt without being smoky. Finishes hoppy and grassy. Bitter palatte. I dont get any of the fruit, sadly.
Largely brown, not red. Somewhat opaque. Puffy white head. Aroma is woody. Taste is bitter, malty. Chalky finish.

Dark red colour, samll off white head with medium retention and a a great off white lace. Aroma of tropical fruits, chocolate and vanilla. Medium body, fizzy strong carbonation, creamy palate dominated by vanilla.
 Taste of chocolate, tropical fruits and too much vanilla essence.

Tallahassee, Fl. - ABC Fine Wine & Spirits - Betton - 12 oz bottle. Slightly murky, medium brown pour, bubbly eggshell white head, light lacing. Aroma of brown sugar, light molasses. Nice sweet flavor, hints of molasses, brown sugar, caramel. Decently thick mouthfeel. Pretty decent.

On gravity at Matlock & Dales beer festival - deep chestnut red with a thin beige bubbly head which fades to a ring. Scarce lacing. Aroma of red berries, caramel, pineapple and hints of chocolate. Taste of chocolate, red berries, sweet caramel and some straw and grass in the finish. Very sweet. Medium to heavy body, oily mouthfeel and soft carbonation.

Malzsüss, voll weizig, angenehm bitter und rotfruchtig startet das Bier vielfältig und interessant. Im Mund dann anfänglich styletypisch säuerlich mit einer roggigen Textur. Am Ende wird es dann noch kantig und weinig. Sicherlich eines der besten Amber Ales. Vom Hahn im OLBAREN Kopenhagen. 25cl/38 DKK.

Deep amber/red pour with small white head. Aroma of dark malts, dark berries and hops. Well balanced with sweet malts and great tasting juicy citrusy hops. Full of complex flavours. A really great experience.

Bottle. Deep red with a big foamy head. Loads of pineapple, peach and grapefruit in the nose. Fruity taste with lots of caramel sweetness and metallic, grass hints. Packed with flavour, well balanced bitter finish. Palate is really smooth. Outstanding.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

330ml bottle. Slight hazy dark reddy/amber colour with a one finger off-white head, long lasting and nice lacing. Aroma: dark fruity malt, raisin, grapefruit. Taste: dark fruits, malt, caramel, citrus, hoppy bitterness at the end, and a rather long bitter aftertaste. Smooth mouthfeel, Medium body and carbonation. Decent.
Clear dark brown body with a thin light brown head. Aroma is ripe fruit, caramel, some grapefruit. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter. Full body, soft carbonation, oily texture.
Nja 33 cl på konserthuset i Örebro. Trodde attentat skulle vara bättre! Lite för bitter!

UPDATED: AUG 24, 2016 On tap (Euston tap - London). Color : dark amber ale with thin white head. Nose : caramel and citrus, biscuit. Aromas : cereals, malt, resin. Watery texture, very low carbonation, strong bitterness (maybe too much).

A bitter red. Big flavour but not entirely pleasant. Very dark colour. 5.8% I drank it cold and gulped it down. Not the subtlest beer, not one to savour. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Reddish brown color. Big head. More aroma and flavor than most Amber ales. Lingering hop bitterness. $4.99 for 11.2 ounce bottle was pricey.

Beer dark brownish red tones and flashing the light. creamy foam beige color, soft texture, like whipped cream silky sensation on the lips. intense aroma of fruit, especially peach, with a malty base and at the same time hoppy. In the mouth we find nuances of bread, cookie and candy very well integrated with the citrus and fruity notes of hops. medium density but very thin and very well done.

0,33l bottle at home from alesbymail.co.uk. bb date unfortunatly not readable anymore. brown / redish color, medium big off-white head. smells of dark fruits, berries, spices, peppery, some passion fruit. good smell. medium body, light carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of light pines, herbal, citric, some exotic fruits, a bit milky / creamy, light peach, spices, peppery, light earthy. finishes lightly bitter with earthy notes and some spicy / peppery notes. good one, taste is rather light which also makes it surprisingly refresing for an amber ale. good.

Served in a tulip from a 330ml bottle. Pours clear ruby-brown colour with a thick beige head. Aroma is citrus hops, grass, caramel. Taste is bitter grapefruit, red berries and pine resin with a pleasant long bitter aftertaste. Full body with medium carbonation. Another enjoyable and well crafted brew by Siren!

Pours very deep Brown with a red hue. Aroma of Rye and make with some citrus hops. Decent carbonation and mouth feel. Taste is nice zesty hopes with a honey sweetness and Rye spice. Nice light bitter finish

Pours red/auburn, frothy off white head. Moderate carbonation. Malt and toffee on the nose. Mixture of sweet, bitter, toffee and plums on the taste. Almost tastes like a traditional bitter, and no bad thing. Decent.

330ml bottle. Clear dark chestnut color. Huge size, thick and fluffy tan head, stays. Fruity, citrus, branches, woody, touch of yeast in aroma. Branches, caramel, citrus, black currant skins/seeds, tart in taste. Woody roast and black currant skins in aftertaste. Dry woody bitterness. Medium carbonation.

Handpump at Tree Folks in Rome-Italy. Dark brown with red highlights, medium ivory head. Nose: amber malt, some burnt roast malts, hint of grass. Mouth: more amber, a bit sweet with a pleasant bitter finish. Easy. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33cl bottle at Pudel, Tallinn. Pours dark, muddy red to mahogany coloured with a moderate, beige head. Malty and hoppy aroma with roasted malt, caramel, lots of citrus, hints of grass, fruits, raisins and bitter herbs. Medium sweet with a quite balanced mixture of malty and hoppy flavours and a bitter finish. Surprisingly flavourful and rather tasty.

Aroma: sweet grape juice, dried fruits, toffee, citrusy and grassy hops.
Taste: light to moderate sweetness, moderate bitterness.
Flavour: biscuits, caramel, lemon zest, bergamot, spicy herbs.
Long bitter finish.


Good with balance on bitter side.

Bottle
Aroma-caramel, fruits
Appearance-dark ruby, clear, tan foam
Taste-medium bitterness, medium sweetness, lightly sour, 
Palate-medium body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-very good
Flaska från johan inhandlad i skottland. Bärnstensfärgad vätska. Maltig och lite rostad doft. Lätt metalliskt smak. Spannmål, rågbröd och bitterhumle

330mL bottle from Booze Bud. BB 120616
Deep bronze body, creamy beige head.
Nice malty nose - quite roasty with burnt nutty toasty, almost liquorice-like with earthy, dried herbal hop notes.
Chewy body, lovely fullness & weight.
Theres a fair bit going on here - roast nuts, burnt sugar, earthy spice, licorice, meaty sort of charry notes,, bitter chocolate, black fruits, rasiny notes. Firm bitterness, drying finish.
Really good!

Tap @ beer emporium, Bristol.
Dark colour, small off-white head, nice lacing. Bitter taste with some coffee & chocolate heaviness, flat.
Very good red ale.

2/3 pint, cask. Pours black with a thin white head subsiding slowly. Scent is medium light caramel and sweet fruits. Taste is medium dense chocolate leaves and light grain. Mouth feel is super dry but also a little milky. Great beer.
On tap on Hanging bat, Edinburgh. Pours dark brown color, beige head. Aroma of citrusy hops, caramel, malt, orange. Taste is medium sweet, medium bitter, citrusy hops, roasted malt, coffee, orange.

Already by its looks this is a hybrid between a red and a black ipa; intensely red aromatic features like burnt raisins (exact commercial deScription), sandalwood mens perfume, tiny hints of roast, passionfruit on top and dried, caramelized mango underneath. Wow! Tastewise, it descends into BIPA territory, grapefruity freshness and bitterness, roast becoming more predominant, some fresh mango and very ripe pineapple sneaking in. Grapefruity bitter finish, lasting for a while. Certainly a slender yet vigorous liquid mistress all geeks could turn to that havent been lucky in love so far.

Bottled @ Örebro Ölcafe. Deep mahogany with a dense tanned head, leaving rich lacing. Malty and citrus hoppy aroma, citrus zest, grapefruit and caramel. Smooth and soft mouthfeel. Earthy taste with bitter citrus notes, grapefruit, blood orange, tangerines also with a perfect malty and fruity sweetness, caramel, toffee and dates. Pine and zesty finish. This is what balance is all about in a brew, tasty and very drinkable!
Le mariage dune rousse et dune ipa, mais au final aucun des deux caractères ne ressort et ça fait un peu fouillis.

Bottle shared with Mait. BB 12.02.2017. Pours an absolutely beautiful purplish ruby red with a thick, well-retaining light tan head leaving good lace. Now thats a looker. Lovely toasty-malty aroma, jammy, red orange peel, redcurrant (jam), marmalade. Tastes pretty straightforward bitter with little sweetness. Sourish red berry and grapefruit flavour, even a hint of sweet strawberry. Nice juicy finish. The bitterness lingers on for quite a long time. A bit hollow mouthfeel, carbonation near minimal. Lovely!

Something went wrong with my bottle: its too carbonated. Big beige head, dark red color. Medium intense aroma of biscuits, caramel, grapefruit and tropical fruits. Medium body, medium bitterness. Like i sad it Was overcarbonated so the mouthfeel wasnt enjoyable at the beginning. Overall its good beer.

Bottle. Hazy red beer, medium off-white head. Nose is hoppy, lots of citrus, caramel, pine, slightly floral notes, some toasty malt. Flavor is citrus, spicy hops, malts, caramel, oranges. Earthy tones in the citric finish, pine and grapefruit.

Dark brown reddish color, big white head. Aroma of citrus, tropical fruits, caramel, pine, hops, forest berries, hint of chocolate. Dry sweet taste with bitter hoppy finish and aftertaste. Medium body and average carbonation. Excellent hoppy dark ale.

Hazy, dark ruby brown colour. Modest white head. Strawberry jam, hints of peach, hints of burnt caramel in the aroma. Strawberries, hints of some other fruits at the beginning. Pours dark red with small top. Aroma is oak barrel, caramel, some grass, hay, fruits, some wood. Taste is bitter, metallic, some oak and other wood, little bit smokiness, putrid planks. Nice beer!
Just numeral rating and highlighted attributes from old notes: caramelly, citrus.

Bottle (from Koht), BB 12.02.17. Pours dark ruby-brown with beige head. The head stays. Aroma is hoppy, fruits, citrus, mango, pine. Flavor is bitter with some sweetness in the background, fruity, citrus, mango. Finish is dry-resin bitter. Body feels a bit weak. Overall: solid hoppy brew.

Botella @Coalla, Oviedo 18/03/2016. BBD:12/06/16
Color ámbar oscuro, sabor caramelo. notas lupuladas, cuerpo medio.

UPDATED: MAR 16, 2016 On tap. Colore rosso scuro tendente al nocciola. Testa breve, granulosa, di dissolvenza da media a celere. Olfatto duva, lievito, luppolo fresco, resina, albicocca, lontano melone. Carbonazione media. Buon aroma maltato pungente duva, luppolo e resina. Gusto nettamente amaro, piccato duva con un potente cuore di luppolo mediamente terroso. Finale maltato, intenso, acuto e piacevolmente esteso. Corpo medio, alcool ben riverberato. Una amber ale nettamente sopra la media, molto soddisfacente, ben fatta, solida e di carattere.
No fui capaz de detectar el sabor ni el olor a lúpulo por ninguna parte, parece más una red ale... no está nada mala pero no es un bombazo de cerveza.

010216. I had this in a bottle that I bought at Archive Beer Boutique and what a cracker of a beer it. Pours into the glass a very deep copper red colour with a mound of light tan foam that holds it shape and stays a while. More malty than hoppy which was good. All round great ber.
Hop centered. citrusy, piney, grassy. A little presence of burnt caramel, but quite bitter. This is not an amber ale, but an Excellent American kind of red ipa
Bottle. Red colour with off-white head. Aroma of hops, grapefruit,, pine. Fruity flavour, bitter, spicy, dry hoppy finish

33cl bottle at home. Dark ruby / amber with a medium white soapy head. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Nice bitterness with subtle fruity tones. Malts, caramel, red fruits, pine and grass. Tasty!

Third, keg, sample tray at Brewdog Clapham Junction. Smell of caramel sweetness, basement and citrus. Dusty hops to the flavour character supported by mild caramel sweetness and offset by a backdrop of tart berries. Drying end, bittersweet. Decent (Battersea, London 29.11.2015).
Couleur très sombre pour une ipa, rouge/brune. Quelques notes de caramel, fruits rouges, malt, un ensemble assez sympathique et assez bien équilibré pour cette ipa anglaise.
Fra keg på Brewdog Clapham Junction 29 Nov 15. Varm rødoransje farge. Filmskum. Svak ferskenaroma. Tynn lacing. Smaken metallisk frukt. Lett tørr avslutning. Uvariert.

Keg at Beergeek Bar. Pours Browny Amber with a White-ish head. Nice doughy aroma with some very nice accompanying hop character. Flavour has more of that cakey, doughy malt and a well integrated citrus hop flavour. Nice bitterness. Im delighted that Beergeek has got the Siren connect.

The aroma is a mix of hoppy fruitiness and dark malts. Siren dont do balance , they do interesting however, and this is certainly that. Taste wise the malts take a backdrop to the explosive hops. Yet it remains very thirst quenching. I really enjoy this beer however Siren is never a brewery that makes beers I can drink lots of. They are always very tasty experiments. This however is so smooth I would happily have a few too many pints of this. Really nice.

Flaska från Utobeer, London. Mörkt brun öl med röda inslag. Beigt skum. Dofter av malt, karamell, trä, grapefrukt, vörtbröd och citrus. Smakinslag av karamell, trä, röda bär, mjölkchoklad och grapefrukt. Rund munkänsla med en viss torrhet. Medelbeska. Bärig avslutning. Riktigt bra.
hazy dark red with a tall, fine head. nice aroma of caramel, choolate, peach and citrus. well-balanced taste. good finish.

From 0,33l bottle, BBD: 020616 Pours hazy dark red brown liquid, big frothy tan head, Aroma: citrus, grapefruit, red orange, caramel, coffee, raspberries, cranberries, Taste: medium sweet, medium bitter, light sour, citrus, grapefruit, coffee, orange, berries, resin, Palate: medium body, average carbonation, slick mouthfeel, long citrus roasty aftertaste, Overall: excellent, very drinkable, enjoyed.
From a bottle. Deep dark amber with bitter roasted flavours up front and a malty smooth finish, not what I expected from a red IPA.

Výčap Beergeek Bar. Toto je amber?! Farba veľmi tmavá, skoro a čierna, pekná hustá krémová pena. Vôňa krásne ovocná, jemne citrusová, chmeľová a praené slady. Chuť na začiatku citrusová, jemne ovocná. Čokoládové tóny, praené slady. Príjemná karamelovo-horká dochuť. Stredná nasýtenosť. Veľmi chutné pivko.
tap at Beergeek, Prague. dark brown color. sweet, caramely, malty aroma. Sweet burnt caramel taste, long hoppy afterflavor. Nice
Tap at Beergeek Bar. Quite rich full malty brew. Also balanced well. Burnt sugar, caramel, toasty, roasted, coffee. Good one.
Tap at. Beer Geek bar.  Very dark brown color with huge off-white head. Citrus hops, dark malt in aroma. Taste, sweet caramel malt, dark malt, followed by nice citrus hops. Tasty.

Bottle in the Sitting Room, Saltburn. Pours ruby with a frothy cream head. Nice fruity aroma with pine notes. The taste is light spice, toasted nuts, red fruit, aniseed with peach and grapefruit. Excellent as youd expect from Siren.
Origin: Tap. Vessel: Stange. Supplier: The Beer Emporium (Bristol). High carbonation and bitterness.

From bottle in ipa glass. Dark reddish brown and high carbonation. Very well balanced, Id say its more bitter than sweet but none stands out excessively. Ive no idea what the hell umami is but if I had to figure out, Id guess this is what it feels like. The first thing that comes to my mind when savouring it is rye bread, I didnt sense any citrus/peach/grapefruit spark though. So no idea why they label it as a red ipa honestly. Its still quite good, anyway.
Mörkt bärnstensfärgad öl med beige skum. Doft av exotisk frukt, karamell mörka bär och lite kåda. Det samma återkommer i smaken.

330ml bottle. Dark amber to copper color with off white head. Malty and hoppy aroma, caramel, light bready, citrusy fruity, pine, grassy. Sweet and biter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Rubí oscuro y espuma beis compacta. Aromas de caramelo, pino, fruta naranja ligera y toque cítrico. Cuerpo medio, inicio dulce breve, de caramelo y toffee, toque cítrico y final de amargor medio resinoso.

Οqaque dark brown with dark ruby tint, small light brown head medium lasting and lacing. Aroma is light hoppy (mixed hoppy aromas with citrus most dominant) with roasted and dark caramel malts(burnt sugar, bitter caramel, dark red fruits, etc). Taste is quite bitter with hoppy and malty balance, hoppy is stronger, some dark fruits again(dried plum), very light notes of coffee/chocolate, little bit of spice(cinammon) as it warms up, amazing. Aftertaste is medium lasting, hoppy and dry. Carbonation is low, body is medium, texture is oily.

UPDATED: MAR 26, 2016 Dark reddish brown with a medium, creamy light tan head. Nice fruity, yeasty malt and marmite aroma. Rich Christmas pudding taste, raisins, currants, marmalade and nice dry bitter finish. Nice one. 

 ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

It pours beautiful sparkling red with creamy off-white head, good lacing, very teasing aromas. Medium body, average carbonation, thick texture, heavily bitter aftertaste. Average malts, cookie, and roasted grains. Average hops, mostly pine and citrus. Tastes of allspice, nutmeg, hints of tobacco, but above all a prevailing taste of bitter almonds. Very complex, surprising and totally tasty. I loved it!

September 17, 2014 - at Southampton Arms; handpull. Deep copper with an attractive mottled beige/tan head (4+). Amazing aroma - real full-malt west coast hoppy ale - resin, citrus, a little toasty grain, with an almost rye bite to it 8+ ... taste follows exactly; a great citrus resin fruity/hoppy full-malt bodied "red" IPA, balanced, some alcohol asserting itself. Average to chewy body, nice airy mouthfeel, fairly long dry bitter pithy finish - terrific stuff.

Light brown head. Brown colour. Aroma is malty, fruity (dried fruits and cherries) and caramel notes. Flavor issltu too with dried fruits and caramel tones, ending a slightly roasty finish. Medium bodied.

Keg at Euston Tap. Pours a cranberry red with small off white head. Aroma of currants, caramel, peach and grapefruit. Taste of sweet currants initially, which goes towards a more bitter grapefruit with small pine notes. Nice amount of carbonation and lacing.

Bottle from More than Beer. Dark amber coloured with an off white head. Nose is caramel, bit of toffee, citrus and pine. Flavour is caramel malts, toasted malts, citric and pine hops. Medium carbonation, medium bodied. Well drinkable.
Exceptional floral and balanced aroma. Great copper color. Tastes like a mild IPA.. smooth, great beer.

Bottle. 
Aroma: Fruitcake, pine and citrus.
Taste: Slighty malty, raisins and citrus with a hoppy finish.

Bit musty, red-brozn with a tan head. Aromas of spruce, light grapefruit and a hue of chocolate develop. Lively, watery texture and medium bodied. Short pungeont sweetness overtaken by significant grassy, spruce hop bitterness. Drying finish.
On tap at brew docks in Dublin. Dark amber color with a medium white head. Medium body and medium carbonation. Aroma of fruit and roasted. Long bitter aftertaste. Very nice.

Many thanks to Gavin for providing the bottle.

Pours a dark red, brownish color, with a huge orange-brown head. Awesome looking beer with an unusual color combination.

The nose offers an interesting interplay between lemon infused blood orange and biscuity, toffee topped malts. Results in a great aroma variety, ranging from a fresh, fruity bitterness to an earthy, sweetness. Its malt foundation grows more profound as the beer warms up, revealing a coppery hint in it.

Has a medium carbonation among a very soft mouthfeel with a surprisingly full and still refreshing appearance.

Hops are on the palate from first glance, revealing grassy qualities, coated up by earthy, slightly wooden malts. The hops grow more bitter, as lime gets present, as do the malts, exhibiting a gentle sweetness, due to toffee and a whiff of caramel. The sweetness gets perfectly adapted by the hops, producing a luscious fruitiness. The finish then reveals bakers chocolate among soft, earthy malts and dry, pleasantly bitter hops.

A pleasantly hoppy red Ipa, with a very well aligned malt and hop bill, featuring an unusual, dough malt profile. Hops gain the upper hand during the dry finish, while the malts are evolving the whole time, interacting perfectly with the them.
Pours a dark reddish brown color with off-white head. Pine, grass, and caramel malts on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes witha nice balance of malt and hop.

[Reading Beer Festival, 2015] - Siren Craft Brewery Liquid Mistress, 5.8%, dunkelbraun mit rötlichem Einschlag, mittlere Krone. Kastanienbraun mit rötlichen Reflexen. Hopfige und schokoladige Noten, rote Früchte. Leicht süßlich. Kräftiger Körper, leicht ölig. Im Antrunk gar nicht süßlich, sondern trocken und bitter. Wiederum hopfige und leichte schokoladige Noten, getragen von einer deutlichen Beerenfruchtigkeit. Zur Mitte dann etwas Grapefruit spürbar, weiter schokoladige Noten. Im Abgang hopfig bitter, anhaltend und kräftig. Sehr interessantes, vielschichtiges Bier.

Cask at CBC Clerkenwell - London. Pours clear, dark red with a fine, foamy head. Loads of dank pine in the nose, some doughy bread, ripe orange. Light to medium sweet flavor with plenty of oily pine, ripe orange, some grainy and toasty bread. Medium bodied with fine carbonation. Lots of resinous, sticky pine in the finish, loads more ripe citrus fruits. Really tasty.
Really good beer. Nose is fruit cake, roasted malts and a hint of hop citrus aromas, taste is similar with nice rich mouthfeel and burnt sugar sweetness and a nice long bitter finish.

Pours hazy amber with medium tan head. Nose is hoppy. Aromas are toasted malts, grass, pine. Medium carbonation, average body. Medium bitter hoppy finish. Nothing stunning, but well-made IPA.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

How: Draught.
Where: The Bishops Arms Marina Plaza, Helsingborg.
Appearance: Hazy amber colour with an off-white head.
Aroma: Tropical fruit, malt, a bit floral.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Caramel, malt, floral, some fruit. Some bitterness in the finish.

This is tasty. Pours red with minimal head. Smells of bitter caramel and hops. Tastes of raisins and citrus with some yeast and bread, but only mildly. Very light mouthfeel, even though there is a bit of stickiness and lingering hops at the end.

Bottle. Thanks to minutemat. Dark brown body with tan head. Aroma is roasted malts with red fruits. Taste is malts caramel malts with hints of fruits coffee an cocoa. Aftertaste is also slightly roasted malts with nice hops bitterness. Nice one

Cask conditioned at Banbury Beer Festival 15. Dark Brown with cream head. A particularly hoppy beer with a rich malty body, red fruits, juicy notes alongside a caramel soothness then the full on hops, peachy, floral notes. Good solid depth, a joy to drink.

Wygląd: beżowa, średnio i dużo pęcherzykowa piana. Opada do niskiego kożucha zostawiając lacing. Utrzymuje się do końca. Barwa brązowa, klarowne, opalizujące.
Aromat: karmel, żywica i sosna. Bardzo wyraźny i intensywny.
Smak: Paloność, krótka i płytka goryczka, grapefruit i leśny posmak.

Średnio wysycone, dobre i odświeżające piwo.

Bottle from McHughs in Dublin. A very nice amber colour with a good foamy head, a bit of caramel and light spiciness with floral and resinous hops. Has a nose of exotic fruit and it comes through in the taste and some bitterness in the finish. A really nice one.

Bottle from Beermerchants.Pours very dark ruby with a big creamy tanned head. Inviting malty and resiny hop aroma. Creamy & smooth mouthfeel. Well balanced, roasted nutty malts, powerful grapefruit, very good one.

330 mml bottle tasted on the 14/04/2015. Amber colour with a foamy white head. Aroma of lights and fresh hops, tropical fruits and orange. Taste is very nice and fresh. One of the best British beers I have ever tasted. Bitter finish with presence of hops but fresh. Next one please!
Dunkelbraun, schaumig. Kiefernnadeln, Malz, leicht röstig, hopfig. Am Gaumen trocken, röstige Bitternoten, Rosinen, Tannine, hopfig.

On tap at Akkurat. Malty smell with some hops, nettles, pine also caramel and a burned aroma. Similar taste with a malty hoppy taste, the hops has a grapefruit aroma. Slightly rough but very drinkable.
One of the best amber ale I tasted. Toast and really fresh. Yummy!!!!!!!

Pours copper with a large lasting head.
Nose shows toasty malt, caramel, spicy and resinous hops.
Flavours include sultanas, golden syrup, bready malt and piny, resinous hops followed by an assertive bitterness.
Much too highly carbonated.

Couleur brune, bonne mousse beige. Nez fort houblonné résineux et fruité exotique. Gout houblonné résineux, sève, avec notes douces maltées voire un peu malt grillé, tourbe, style black ipa, et notes fruitées. Bon corps. Fin longue amère. Pas mal!

Bottle 33cl, an amber brown beer with huge copper head. Nose is intense on exotic fruits, honey and hops resin. Aroma is very sweet, resinous, caramel and chocolate notes, floral, good complexity and balance, toasted caramel, good bitterness, clean. Finish is quite bitter with a nice toasted malt notes and duration, well done.

11th March 2015: 33cl bottle, BBD 31 Dec 2015. Taken in Chez Sophie, Shrewsbury. Good looking beer, ruby red hue to the body, a tanned topping finished it off nicely. Maybe the colour helped, but I got red berries in both the nose and flavour along with a mixed basket of other fruity esters and tastes all rolled up in a semi-sweet malty base. Very drinkable.
Bottle. very dark red-brown. Roasty aroma, some tropical juice too. Roasty bitterness, some hops and a little woodsy. Quite light body, roasty finish and a wee bit dry. Ok

Cask, Ale House, Chelmsford, 28th Saturday 2015.

Mangos, grapefruit, orange peel, coriander and perfume on aroma. Taste is oranges, lemons, mangos, mild coriander and starburst sweets. Top malt profile and incredibly clean. Superb.

33cl bottle, purchased at Stirchley Wine and Spirits, consumed in Dubai on 27/02/15. Dark brownish red colour. Light to medium body with medium carbonation. Aroma of hops and oranges. Full flavour - sweet citrus fruits, bitter hops and some caramel. An excellent ale.

On tap at Six Ten Brewing 
Clear dark golden with a medium sized off-white head, good lacing. Aroma of toasted malts, caramel and bready. Flavors of roasted malts, dusty and bready 
Ok

330ml bottle at home. Pours almost a blackish red, almost to the point that it looks like a black IPA, medium to small off white head. Aroma is an interesting mix of citrus, raisins, bread, and plums? Taste is similar, very complex, citrus and tropical fruit hops with dark fruit in the malts, some bread base, but definitely raisins, plums, or the like. Lovely interpretation of the style.

On tap at Six Ten. Pours a cloudy amber with medium creamy beige head that lasts leaving sticky lacing. The aroma is raisin and bready malt. Medium mouth with rich toffee, raisin, bready malt, very good.
A fresh tasting red ipa, for its relatively low abv, it has good hop flavour, although it feels a little thin. A great summer beer.
UPDATED: MAR 11, 2017 Pours deep ruby red/brown with a tan head. Aromas of malt, grapefruit, raisins. Flavours of the same, with a lingering bitterness. Rich, sticky caramel. Lovely.

33cl. Bottle. 
Pours dark reddish with tan head.  
Aroma roasted malts, caramel, citrus, grapefruit, pine, raisin, some peach. 
Taste piney resin dry bitter, some caramel sweets, sour hint. 
Mouthfeel thin. 
Great beer! Im thinking an older bottle, although the nose was still quite hoppy there was something old.

From tap at Siren Brewery. Brown Colour with rubby flashes. Malty aroma biscuits, dry fruits, ginger, Orange. Some chocolates hints also. Grapefruit peel, earthy, resiny taste with still strong hoppiness in aftertaste.

Reddish color with a frothy light beige head with good duration and medium lacework. Aroma has notes of resins, light caramel and bittery oranges. Flavor is fruity, notes of resins, pine and light burnt sugar. Decent bitterness in the final with a sensation of astringency on palate.

Bottiglia 33cl @ giangaspero.
Rossa con bella schiuma.
Beverina e luppolata il giusto.
Una delle poche amber degne di nota mai bevute

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhold

Bottle bought at the Bottle Shop at home. Pours amber with a big fluffy head. Very sweet hoppy, fruity smell. Lots of orange peel, pineapple, lychee. Orange peel, flowers, grapefruit. Very bitter aftertaste. Id drink this all day.

I wasnt too impressed by this beer. Though the appearance looked very nice, and it had a wonderful head, the taste wasnt anything too special. I could taste some coffee and caramel about halfway through the sip, however that was it. It would be a nice beer to sit and drink for awhile, otherwise, there wasnt much there.

somewhat gassy ale large head creamy colour rich red hue pour aromas pine citrus biscuit toffee mild syrup good notes the flavours mango biscuit grapefruit medium strong bitter mildly crisp ale toffee peach smooth on palate the finish best tastes hops sweet lasting malts bitter pine mix just love the sweetness lovely ale
draft at Blue Monk, Buffalo NY. deep amber pour, creamy body. Chocolate/cocoa notes, sweet malts, touch of raisins. Nice mouthfeel. Good amber

Deep amber colour with a good amount of consistent foam. Faint aroma of berries. Great taste of raisins, malt and sugary treats, great balance. Treacherous, it good down very well and very quick I loved it, will have more and buy it to friends. The design of the bottle itself is sufficient to give it a go.
Draft. Maroon brown color, tan head. Nice aroma of pineapple, raisins. Taste has fruity toffee, caramel. head and shoulders above most ambers.
Pours a black colour. Taste is creamy, coffee, fruity hops and fresh tasting. Top quality beer

Hazy amberish color with a fine tan head. Ok lacing. Medium + body. Tad sweet and an ok bitterness. Floral, fruity and bready aroma. Nice ok flavor with some fruity notes, a bit bready, some chocolate and floral. Nice tasty ale.[On tap at Crowbar in Oslo, Norway]

[5964-20131020] Cask. Mild poppy tea grains aroma. Slightly hazy, dark amber red body with a quick bubbly off-white head. Bitter leaf and grainy malt flavour. Medium body. Good, didnt like the aroma at first. (7/3/7/4/15) 3.6
(Cask Days 2013 @ Brickworks, Toronto, ON)

Many thanks to ThirstyBird for sharing this bottle! Very great floral nose. The beer starts floral-intense, slightly sourish with an intense and earthy floralness. Nice fresh pine, floral intense, fresh and easy to drink with still a nice earthy aroma. The aftertaste is fresh, intense malty-earthy-dry with a nice pine-like floral hoppyness and a moderate bitterness.

Many thanks to bobinlondon for hauling this under the English channel for me!! Pours a hazy reddish brown with a tan head. The smell is cracker, citrus. The taste is as it smells cracker, citrus with a dry ending. The body is light+ with nice carbonation.

text: Bottle at home. Grassy hoppy bitterness combined with a hint of caramely raisin sweetness. Malty biscuit tones. Medium body. Very tasty indeed :p

33cl bottle from Oddbins, London Bridge. Pours a nice oaky brown with small beige head. Aromas of dough, vanilla and resiny hops. Tastes of chocolate, caramel, with a slightly bitter hoppy aftertaste. Little bit thin in texture but quite an enjoyable beer this one.
on tap at olbaren. rich black with a steady brown head; aroma of brownie dough; lightly bitter chocolate floavours, hints of vanilla and plum jam. decent stuff
On draught at the Nags Head in Reading. Dark red with a creamy head. Lovely smooth flavour, sweet, vanilla, and with decent bitterness. Slips down nicely.
Cask at the Craft Beer Co. Covent Garden. Pour is dark, aroma is toffee. Taste is toffee, fruity, light alcohol notes and some coffee notes on the finish. Good
Delicate Red Ale blossoms in your mouth. Smooth taste. Suttle Hop taste and aroma with a nice punch!
Bottle from Beer Dock, Crewe. Pours red brown with a tan head with a red hue. Spicy red ale with a citrus kick. Very flavoursome but maybe a bit much of a thing.
Tap at mikkeller and friends. Dark brown color, tanned head. Aroma is balanced malty, hoppy, caramel. Taste is balanced malty and hoppy, sweet caramel, fruity.

Mild chocolatey aroma with a massive hit of dark roasted flavour. Dark brown looks like coke. Slight head with creamy appearance. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Really good. Dark wood coloured with a red hue. Small white head, some lacing. Aroma of caramel malts and fruity hops. Medium / light body. Taste is a great balance of malt, raisins, caramel, peach and grapefruit.
Bottle from sandinista, manc. Deep maroon, with an eggshell head. Aroma is dry caramel grapefruit. Taste is syrupy sweetness and fruity bitterness. Full bodied with some oil. Nice.
Cask at Craft Beer Islington, red with a lasting thin head, light pine hoppy nose, body is caramel with pine and toffee notes, lightly spicy. Nice.

Bottle shared with Simonsen
Dark red, creamy tanned head. Smell of toast, burnt caramel, citrus, dark fruits, dark malts. Moderate sweet, more dark fruits and malts, chocolate quite complex malt base. Moderate to medium bitter finish. Very nice amber; for once properly hopped
Botella de 33 cl, en La Birra. Color ambar. Sabor a malta, caramelo, lupulo, ligeramente a chocolate, citrico.

(bottle, 33cl) Mahogany colour with a medium-sized tanned foamy head. Fruity and piney hoppy aroma combined with toasted dark malt, including notes of citrus, grapefruits, berries, as well as notes of caramel, leather and traces of tar. Moderately bitter and slightly sweet flavour, medium to light bodied with a moderate carbonation. Toasty malt character with notes of caramel and fruity hops with hints of citrus, dark and red berries; moderately dry bitter hoppy and slightly sweet malty finish with caramel, a whiff of chocolate and fruity hops in the aftertaste. Nice one. 22.IX.14

On keg at the Craft Beer Rising event at the Drygate brewery. Style wise I wasnt sure this did the amber ale thing - in some elements, it almost had the richness of a barley wine, with big orangey/raisin notes against a toffee background. In other parts, there was a fresher fruit thing happening - mango perhaps. Overall, it satisfied all flavour zones of the palate even if it wasnt the expected amber ale.
Bottle. Murky dark red/brownish pour with thick tan head. Aroma is fresh with tropical fruit. Full taste with quite a lot of sweetness. Medium carbonation
330ml bottle, dark amber pour with off white head, malty aroma, light roast, caramel, toffee, piney hop and citrus.
Bottle. Brown colour with a beige head. Aroma is roasted malt, chocolate, pine. Flavour is roasted malt, chocolate, hop, pine, citrus, caramel. Medium body. OK beer.

Cask at The Hanging Bat. Pours clear reddish amber, thick just off-white head. Aromas of raisins, pine, resin. Taste is bitter with a good toffee malt backbone. Creamy texture, chewy almost, slightly sticky finish, but good.

On tap @ Mikkeller, Bangkok. Deep dark reddish brown colour, stable beige head. Hoppy aroma and taste, dry, interesting finish with chocolate, mocha and vanilla. Lively carbonated, medium body, soft mouthfeel. Black IPA-ish.

Bottle. Creamy lightbrown good fully lasting head. Red amber colour. Heavy malty and hoppy aroma. Heavy bitter wonderfull hoppy bitter flavor. Licorice and caramel. Long heavy bitter finish. Creamy palate.

Draft at at Edmunds Oast. Deep red pour with a creamy white head. Massive grapefruit, kumquat and tangerine hop character on the nose with some underlying bready and caramel malt notes. Flavor is just as bold and hop forward with a lengthy bitter finish. Very solid stuff.
330ml bottle from The Real Ale Store, Newark. Dark red/brown colour, with a tan head. Smooth body. Aroma has raisins, and hops, the flavour flows, with a medium bitterness to finish.

UPDATED: SEP 21, 2016 . Deep golden, low carbonation, golden creamy lace. Bisquit malt, earthy/strawberry, herbal and citric hops. Chewy mellow mouthfeel. Flavourfull strong bitter, and a good one at that.

Bona cervesa, és bastant equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, es bastante equilibrada y sabrosa.

Pour une rouge, robe brun très foncé avec quelques néanmoins reflets rubis. Mousse chocolat au lait moyenne et crémeuse. Nez de houblons résineux, de caramel, malt grillé, vin rouge. En bouche, lattaque est fort amère, sèche, la résine domine, pamplemousse (mais cest peut-être lamertume qui me fait cet effet), pain grillé. Lamertume est très tenace. La longueur fort honnête. Le corps est liquoreux. Assez brutale, mais sympathique.
Cask at Craft Clerkenwell. Aroma is red ipa like. Great taste though. Citrus and resinous hops, light sweet maltiness, almost creamy but in the background. Pretty nice! Biscuity.
Taster at Euston tap. Plenty of floral hops. Sweet caramel fruity flavour. Lasting Strawberry finish. Lovely.
Half at euston tap. Keg. Tony red, foamy tan head. Lovely, floral hop nose. Flavour is gorgeous caramel malt, backed by a fruity hop bitterness. Lush mouthfeel, long malty finish. Really good.
Bottle Bel ambrato rosso buona schiuma piuttosto persistente maltatura decisa note fruttate lieve resona luppolatura piuttosto intensa buon amaro

0,33 l bottle 
spruce, citrus, cereal, red, hazy, frothy, tan foam, light sweetness, very bitter, medium body, oily feel, average carbonation,
Flaske medbrakt fra esp0r. Mørk brun/Rødaktig uklar farge. Beige tynn skumtopp. Smaker malt, karamell, tre, noe sjokolade og mørk frukt. Ganske så god men kjenner ingen smak av humle her.
Dark amber, yellowish head which soon dissipates. Aromas of malts and ripe fruits. Taste medium sweet and bitter. Fair carbonation. Finish slightly too sweet. Not my favourite by Siren but decent.

Rich hops aroma, spruce and floral, with loads of nice amber malts to balance. Great fresh appeal yet with that warming twist, which really elevates this above just the hops. Those malts are a bit biscuit yet also fruity like and even have some chocolate notes. Taste is really hoppy though and just very rich and fresh and nice. Great drinkable body. And all that at less than 6%... I am honestly impressed! Would love to drink this all the time -- I might have to try to brew a clone. (33cl bottle from Saveur Bière)
Keg at the Vintage. Pours amber red, sweet toffee malts, bitter, fruity, burnt finish.
Tasty, flavoursome, a little creamy, always getting more than you expected with siren which is good, bottle at the bottle shop. A really nice red beer.

On tap at Euston Tap, pours a dark amber with a large beige head. Nose reveals metallic notes, not a whole lot else. Flavour is a bit metallic too, with secondary notes of earthy bready malt. Something quite off about this - surprised at the ratings. Okay, but not great.
Nose is red apple, decent syrup note, leaves, celery, feel is medium, taste is red apple, menthol, cooked vegetables, late dry malt

On tap at The Local Pub, Athens Greece. Copper red body with a light red-pink head (!!!). Aromas of citrus and caramel. taste or citrus, maybe lemon and orange, with caramel and bready notes following. Bitter aftertaste, dry and pretty long. Medium body with low carbonation.
@Öltripp Köpenhamn. Humlig doft med inslag av kaffe, samma i smak. Bra beska, torr...

1/3 pint flight, Keg, Brewdog Sheffield, post viva celebrations. Deep brown, Mild raisin and brown sugar aroma, semi sweet and smooth. More sweetness on the finish. Very drinkable, not too sweet, though wouldnt want too many for a session.

Cask conditioned	air pressure	Euston Tap	London	30/04/14. A dark brown coloured beer with a ruby hue and a white head and lace. Creamy in texture and a little bit in flavour too, but certainly very hoppy. a chocolatey note from the malts. A bit too sweet for me. A good but perhaps chewy body.

Bottle at home from Brewtique, Macclesfield. Pours a reddish amber with a medium off white head. Citrus, peach, sweet malts, biscuit. Enjoyed this, wasnt amazing but a pretty solid effort. Decent beer this.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein dunkel bernsteinfarbenes Bier mit geringer Schaumkrone. Geruch fruchtig malzig, sehr hopfig. Geschmack leicht hopfig, fruchtig malzig, exotische Früchte.

Tap at Siren Tap Takeover @ Mikkeller Bar, february 13th 2014. Hazy red golden body with a medium offwhite head. Aroma of biscuit, rye, peach, grapefruit. Taste of mild toasted malt, citrus fruits, grass. Bitterness in nice play with the rather high sweet malt element. Grassy finish with caramel. Maybe not a typical ipa by style, this take on it works pretty well.

Draft. Dark mohogany beer with a tan head. Cocoa and grapefruit aroma. Cocoa and light grapefruit flavor with caramel. Medium bodied. Decent bitterness. Caramel and light cocoa lingers with light grapefruit.

En fût au Parker Pie. Couleur brun foncé, mousse moka crémeuse laissant une belle dentelle. Arôme de houblon feuillu, malt caramélisé. Goût de houblon, malt caramel, café léger, amertume contenue. Carbonatation moyenne, corps moyen, huileuse.

UPDATED: JUN 30, 2014 on tap @ BBF 2014 - Barcelona, ES - Color: amber clear beer with no carbonation and small white heavy foam. Smell: high hoppy domination, grass and floral. Taste: hoppy explosion with good balance of malt. Really drinkable. Aftertaste: nice bitterness. I recommend it!!!
-----
bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: dark black beer with no carbonation and small white heavy foam. Smell: roasted malt and high hoppy nose as a black IPA. Nice roasted malt taste with good hoppy taste and bitterness, small caramel notes. Aftertaste:: roasted malt, black bread and chocolate. GREAT!

Bottle. Pours dark brown with a small beige head. Aroma of malt, caramel, some burnt notes, pine and citrus. Flavor is sweet and malty with some carmel, chocolate, citrus and pine. Medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle. An unclear, brown beer topped by a small, dense, light beige head. The aroma has a nice piney, citrusy touch, with roasted, chocolatey notes. Sort of like sticking the nose into a bag of hops, with chocolate and roasted malts as well. The flavor has a fine bitterness, its quite dry and pleasantly carbonated, full body. Lasting bitter finish with roasted malts, chocolate and some cocoa. Some notes of diacetyl in the very end. A quite pleasant and tasteful one. 140420

Bottle 330ml @ Geokkjer
Pours dark reddish brown with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, biscuit, orange, citrus, grape and peach. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter with a long caramel and bitter finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottled. Pours slightly hazy and deep, red brown with an average lacing, beige head. Aroma of caramel, peach, grapefruit and pine. Sweet flavor that ends up dry and nice bitter. Medium bodied, oily texture and soft carb. A very nice IPA indeed.

Cloudy copper color, off-white head. Nutty flavor, roasted malt, slightly metallic finish. Medium body, medium carbonation. Nah.

330 ml bottle. Dark brown, almost black body with a medium sized, dense, long lasting beige head. Strong aroma dominated by pine, but also citric fruit and good malt. Flavor is sweet, dark, soft malt, citric fruit and pine with good bitterness. Fine body and nice bitter and malty aftertaste. Very nice and balanced, not really an IPA, has a lot more in common with a black IPA, but who cares. Ready for this one anytime.

33cl bottle at restaurant "la cuina de luribou", Barcelona. Dark red, dark brown color. Medium brown head. Smooth body. Medium high bitterness. Medium sweetness. Aroma is raisins, wood, hop and light alcohol. This is a good beer but I dont think this is an IPA...

Tap at Bar Animal. Deep golden, low carbonation, golden creamy lace. Bisquit malt, earthy/strawberry, herbal and citric hops. Chewy mellow mouthfeel. Flavourfull strong bitter, and a good one at that.

@ BrewDog Stockholm: ingen större verken smak eller doft. Kanske några små brända toner. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: AUG 11, 2014 Cask west riding dewsbury. Great red brown colour good beigre head and lacing. Aroma is fruity. Taste is sharp red fruits and good caramel malts long grapefruit bitter finish. Nice body and mouthfeel. Good stuff.

Keg at Draft House. Dark red / brown with a big foamy beige head. Aroma of rosewater and grapefruit. Body is medium, slightly foamy, carbonation is medium to low. Taste - toffee, citrussy hops, hoppy without being overly bitter. Balanced yet fairly punchy. Good condition. Very nice.

Aroma sweet of red berries and deep malt. Pours dark red with a little fine white head. Really soft, silky texture, the sweetness comes through in the flavour but the hops get a bit lost. There is microbrewed flavour in here of slight amateur but its a good beer nonetheless
Cask at Leicester CAMRA Beer Festival 2014. Reddish brown ale. Complex aroma of sweet chocolate and burnt toast. Bitter but not overly so - more fruity sultanas than bitterness in this.

Bottle at home. Dark red pour, almost no head. Aroma of rye, citrus, floral, some licorice and a little spicy. Flavor is quite bitter, nicely sweet, powerful hops and backed with a full body malt character. Nice balance and very drinkable. Huge beer for the low abv.

Keg. Dark red ale with a thick tan head. Smells of red berries and sherbert. Red berries and charcoal. Fizzy in the mouth. Finish is fresh and fruity with a little bit of a grapefruit lemon kick. Tasty, like an alco pop.
2014 - 02 - 21 330ml bottle. medium brown colour. small tan head. roasty dark fruit in aroma. bitter-sweet taste.

Cask (gravity) @ EBF14 2013, 14th Egham Beer Festival, Egham United Services Club (EUSC), 111 Spring Rise, Egham, Surrey, England TW20 9PE.Clear medium to dark brown red color with a small to average, frothy - fizzy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, caramel, light heavy hoppy, orange - citrus, pine, grapefruit, wood, fruity. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, fruity, wood, malt. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20130330]
Tap @ Fermentoren, Köpenhamn 7/2-2014. Fruktig och humlig, grapefrukt, karamell. Ganska lång, humlig och torr avslutning. Tycker den påminner en hel del om en Black IPA.

330 ml bottle from Ales By Mail, served in a nonic pint glass. Lovely dark copper colour, quite clear, with a light beige head, rocky and persistent leaving good lacing. Aroma of red berries, slightly toasted malts, light nuttiness, citrusy hops and some pine needles. Perfectly balanced in the mouth, again slightly nutty and roasted (with some burnt caramel presence) well complemented by a fruity, marmelade-like kind of flavour. Resinous and moderately bitter aftertaste. Average carbonation, medium body and creamy texture. Very nice!
On tap at original Mikkeller. Bitter with resiny hops aromas. Some pale many aromas with hints of Vienna malts. Medium to light bodied. Medium to soft carbonation bitter finish.

330ml. Deep ruby under a fine garlic-hued collar. Nose of Black Jacks, burnt juniper berries, blackcurrant wine gums, coal and lavender. Slick condition; similar flavours; plenty of cranberry, soap and incinerated rose. Chalk and roast finish; plenty of hop action on the belch; a warming splash of pastis. Another winner from (statistically) my favourite English brewery.

Bottle @ 2nd Tuesday Tasting. Pours a clear reddish beer with a thin off white head on top. Aroma is very hoppy, citric, and has slight malty touch in the beginning. Flavor is medium bitter, nice and hoppy with more grassy notes. Again the malt is present in the background, backing this beer up in a wonderful way. Slght cloying mouthfeel. Very nice British IPA.
Bottle @ tasting. Aroma is bread, Rye, light liquorice, fruity and floral hops. Flavour is quite bitter with fruity hops, caramel and bread.

Fra fad, Fermentoren. Særegen IPA. Rødbrun m beige skum og duft af kiks, kaffe, ristet malt, malt-brød og humle, ikke mindst solbær, graefrugt og urter. Medium bitter finish og en ikke tung men god krop med en let sødme.

Aroma: caramel malts, fruity and floral hops. Appearance: hazy dark brown, small white head. Taste: light sweet and bitters. Palate: toasted malts, mild bitterness. Overall: quite amazing IPA, big fan. Pint at the Craft Beer Co. Clerkenwell, London.
Fragrant, fruity, juicy and intriguing; hop and malt combine to produce lots of character.

Draft @ Hoppy Loft.
Ambrée/cuivrée, col café au lait.
Arôme est légèrement grillé, pointe malté caramel avec qcq résiduel assez doux et un léger houblonné citronné.
Palais est malté assez moyen, amertume houblonnée léger. Impression dune petite Black IPA. Note résiduelle de sève et aiguilles de pin. Touche anisée accompagnée par un malté grillé et crystal restant dans un style très anglais.

Caña en cimmeria 27-01-2014. en el momento. Color rojizo bastante oscuro y turbio. Cuerpo medio con espuma beige poco persistente. Sabores algo dulces de caramelo y tostados al inicio quedando al final suave amargo que permanece en boca un buen rato. buena para repetir sin problema. buena Marca y descubrimiento por el momento.
Bottle. Dark red/brown with a thin head. Tastes like a hopped amber ale - a real mix of bitter citrus with fruit malt. Delicious.

330ml bottle from Beer Ritz. Marmalade / citrus nose from the bottle, pours dark with a fluffy beige head.. lots of bitter rye with an aftertaste a bit like those Guinness crisps that were on sale for about 10 minutes last year. Theres a sweetness in there, a little citrus with a few sultanas. Not bad.
Rödbrun i färgen, saknar nästan helt krona. Smakar som flytande vörtlimpa på ett bra sätt!
Plenty of aroma, good on the nose. Good head straight from the bottle. Roasty, burnt caramel, with a big dry finish. Would happily seek this out again.

On tap @Cimmeria, Oviedo. Pours hazy reddish with nice creamy off white head. Some head retention and good lacing. Fruity, berries, peachy, caramel aromas. Medium body, average carbonation and oily texture. Taste is very fruity, caramel, peachy, some grapy notes. Mild bitterness. Sweet aftertaste. Quite enjoyable.

Great note to strike between an amber and an IPA. Its got the biscuits, raisins and dry finish from the malt but citrus and grass from a rich, smooth backbone of hops. Would be happy to see this Red IPA concept take off.
33 cl bottle @ home. Pours brown with some sediment and an off-white head that leaves quite a bit of lacing. Aroma and flavour are pepper, fruity hops, caramel, and resin - with a dry finish.

On tap @ Henrik, Bergen. Pours a slightly hazy red body with a medium creamy off-white head. Nose is red berries, herbs, wet grass, peaches and hints of caramel. Taste is caramel, coffee-like grainy tones, bitter herbs and hints of wet grass, peaches and nuts. Medium body and carbonation. Very malty for an IPA, more like an amber ale of sorts. Still, rather nice and very drinkable.
Pours a deep dark hazy amber. Quite malty but with enough bitterness. Somewhat more full body. Good beer

On tap @ Olympen. Oh, its really really deep and dark for an IPA. Brown and a bit rubyish cloudy with a small kinda sidesticking beige top. The nose has lots and lots of dark hoppy goodness. Smells a bit of rye and bread with lots of dark slightly burned - and chocolate notes. Smells a lot this, and Im really enjoying this aroma. Lovely flavor as well. Says on chart board that this is a IPA, but this is more a well hopped amber IMO. Rich oily mouthfeel on this and then carbonation is mild, creamy and prickling. Bitter chocolate biscuit , lots grassy hops with a thick malty sweet dark caramel sweetness in there base. Its really loaded with flavor this. Have to admit that this is absolutely my kind of beer. 17.10.2013

330ml bottle. Dark red colour, foamy beige head leaving some lacing and aroma of malt caramel with raisins & floral, fruity, citrus hop. Taste is biscuity malt with roasted notes and orange & grapefruit citrus, earthy, pine, hoppy bitterness. Oily mouthfeel, medium bodied, soft carbonation, dry bitter finish. Quite drinkable.

Small, all but gone fast tannish head over chestnut-brown beer with a faint haze. Caramel, even some toffee. Burnt notes mixing with fruity USA hops. A jumble at face value, but definitely attractive. Ripe banana, dry hopbales, molasses, grapefruit. Sweet / roasted / fresh hopbitterness. Maybe not the first try at this combination, but with a really novel, successfull result. Remarkably balanced flavourwise. Dark sultanas, roasted dried figs, molasses, baked pisang - and hops... Spritzy, slightly slick-caramelized; medium bodied at best. Another remarkable craft intruder in CAMRA-land. Shocking!

330ml bottle (BierKompass.de)
Really deep red, persistent beige head. Quite heady hop aroma, some almost winey sharpness. Later, youre left with heavier sticky dark caramel, some cakiness. Fairly watery in the mouth, crisp carbonation. Dark burnt treacly malts. Herbal to grassy hop aromatics in the mouth, some odd chalkiness. Does have that "red" aspect that Im really keen on. Finish caramelly, and with bitter leafy hops. Grapefruity too, and with a metalllic tingle too. Kinda nice in some ways, but the drinkabilitys not so high. Could have done a "danish tick", as theres nothing interesting after the first sip.
Pours amber/red. Nose of bread pudding with a slight hint of cinnamon. Tastes like sticky toffee pudding with added fruits raisins, dates and oranges. (Rating backlog tasted on or around 19/06/13)

Bottle. Pours clear amber with a red glow and a medium off-white head. Aroma has toast, perfume, malts, raisin, toffee and some grapefruit. Taste has raisin, chocolate, grapefruit and a medium bitter finish, which is quite dry. Medium body and carbo. A bit strange, but quite tasty considering the abv.
Gedronken met dutchdrebus. Bruine kleur met beige schuimkraag. Ruikt hoppig, fruitig, chocolade, caramel. Smaakt een beetje stoutig, dunne stout, hoppig.

Bottle @ ansjelaahs birthday/Christmas. Dark ruby to black colour with a small beige head. Smells hop, hay, malt, coffee, chocolate. Tastes hops, malts, chocolate.. Black ipa ish. Could use more hops though. Medium to full body, nice carbo.

330ml bottle from Good Spirits Co, Glasgow (£2.80):
Hoppy with some tropical fruits, pine and citrus along with some sweeter malts and a few darker fruits as well. A good balance with nothing coming acorss too strong or overpowering, the aroma is rich with some nice caramel too.

Dark brown with some red & a 0.5cm llight tan head that holds well.

Hoppy with pine & grapefruit plus lots of bitterness and some citrus fruits plus the sweet, caramel malts that appeared in the aroma as well. Quite a pleasant taste but perhaps just that little bit too bitter in places.

Medium bodied and bitter with a smooth and creamy feel to it. Definitely hoppy and sweet with a dry, bitter infused finish that goes down well.

A nice cross between an American IPA and a hop-filled red ale that had a nice balance between flavours and a pleasant, smooth body that results in a pretty good beer.
Hazy red beer with a hop and strong malty aroma. Taste is malty with an edge of hop and bitter fruit. Very tasty.

Tap @SBWF 2013
Deep clear amber color, small beige head. Caramelly, "ryeish" aroma. Medium-bodied. Caramel, rye, sweetness, malty, not so much bitterness. Good.
Cask at Pivni, York. Tropical fruit juiciness. Well balanced malt. Some dryness, and a long, bitter, grapefruit finish.

18/XI/13 - 33cl bottle from De Hopduvel (Gent) @ home - BBE: II/2014 (2013-1089) 
Clear dark brown to purple beer, irregular creamy beige head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: red fruit candy, red liquorice, ripe forest fruits, bit piny, some overripe fruits, hint of mocha, dusty. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: bitter start, sourish, bit lemony, mocha and caramel, slightly sweet malts. Aftertaste: red fruits, some chocolate, caramel, bitter hops, bit piny, mocha.

Bottled, BB Feb 2014, large sample. Dark redbrown color, short light brownish head. Aroma of pine and grapefruit, some biscuity malt, hint of raisin. Like a barley wine light. Quite bitter in taste, again raisiny malty sweetness. Great stuff.
Aroma of caramel, citrus fruits, malts and bread. Taste is quite sweet with medium bitterness and some lemon.
Really deep, slightly hazy red with a thin off-white head. Aroma of caramel malt, earthy, citrus hops. Sweet taste with a medium bitter ffinish. Oily texture, low carbonation. Good beer.

Bottle - dark ruby colour with beige head. Nice aroma, hops. Malts, chocolate, resin, dark fruit. Nice taste, malty, hoppy, chocolate, nice late bitterness. Nice but not sure its an IPA.

Tap @ konttori. Pours ruby red with a small white head. Malty, hops aroma. Hops but quite malty.

Láhev 330 ml. Aroma je velmi chutné, chmelové s nádechem ovoce, předevím citrusů. Pěna je nahnědlé barvy, jemná, mohutná a drící. Barva samotného piva je tmaví měděná a silně kalná. Jedná se o vskutku výtečné pivo s velmi svéráznou chutí a dobrou pitelností.

Somehow managed to write this to a wrong beer, so heres a fix. Correct date is 8th of November.

Dark ruby with a decent off-white head. Aroma is rather nice, fruity hops and a hint of pine. Britishness stands in the back, which to me is a plus. Same goes with the taste, rather medium plus mouthfeel with a decent fruity bitterness. The british toffeeish taste is not really there and I would actually call this an ipa. Positive surprise.

Draught at the Konttori, Tampere, Finland.
Dark reddish brown colour with a small tan head.
Fruity and sweet hoppiness and malt in a balanced aroma.
The flavour is balanced with dark maltiness, piney hops and mild bitterness. Very nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Rehills, Newcastle. This is a dark red-brown beer with chocolate and rich red fruity flavours, sarsaparilla and malty notes with a rich creamy toffee, blackcurrant and roasted finish. Superb!

Bottle. Dark brown with an off white foam. Aromas are nutty with chocolate and low woody, floral pine. Spicy with lactose and hints of toffee. Energy malt drink with the merest hint of shit. Flavours are chocolate milkshake and coffee with nutty notes. Spicy with grapefruit and apricot. Earthy with berries and dry biscuit. Very good.

Copper clear beer with beige head leaving lacing. Aroma is just Brit hop bitterness. Flavor is also bitter and caramelly sweet. Mouthfeel is thick and oily. Long finish. Surprisingly good taste after the faint flavor.
Bottle. Brown with a small head. Hops dominate to a point where they come a bit overpowering. One of these beers which I think I should like but for aome reason cant quite warm to it.
081113. Tap at Konttori, Tampere. Pours clear dark ruby with a nice head. Aroma hops, caramel, nuts. Slightly sweet hippy body. Nice balance. Not Bad.

from Erzbierschof - cloudy ruby-brown beer with a little beige foam left; a biscuity maltiness and a fruity hoppiness; notes of marzipan and metal; medium-bodied and quite astringent; decently bitter, notes of blood and licorice in the finish along with more malty tones
Lite fruktig i aromen, kanske lite russin. Lite rostad malt. Smaken är rätt lätt, dock väldigt balanserad.

On tap at Cardinal. Deep clear mahogany color with a small tanned head. Fruity polleny hops on the nose and in the mouth. Fruity and malty. Full bodied and smooth. Fresh and inviting impression. Highly recommended.
On tap. Ruby brown with brownish head. Aroma fruity, flowers, tropical fruit, slight roasted, dark caramel. Taste is medium sweet, dark caramel, fruit, flowers and slight roasted notes.

330ml bottle. Cloudy dark brown colour with small, frothy, to creamy, half-way lasting, moderately lacing, beige head. Hoppy aroma has a touch of pine, hints of grapefruit and tangerine, malty background with biscuit note, a chocolate touch, cautious hints of roast. Taste is bitter hoppy, minimally piney, cautious hints of roast, dark chocolate with orange touch, grapefruit. Close(r) to an Black IPA.

Where and how:  Cask days 2013 
Aromamalty sweetness up front with dry hop sides.
 Appearance : 
Top: medium off white, tanned rocky cap.
Base: hazy amber with ruby hints.
Palate :  easy going ale, medium bodied, soft.
Taste: Nice nutty character with woody feel. Nice character shown. Late side end bitterness. 
 Other notes  solid cask.

Bottle at home 
Pours very dark brown , almost black , with an off white head 
Not realy a scent 
Enters very smoothly and sweet . I get chocolat in it ( ? ) malts , some sugar and a very low amount of hop in the back ( ipa ? ) 
Very weird , plastic-ish taste .. Hah ... 
Its a good beer , but im drinking this next to the soundwave of them and that thing is lots and lots better !

33 cl bottle.
Pours murky dark red color with a medium sized head. Aroma has hops, caramel malts, some resin, sweet fruits and some nutty notes. Flavor is also sweet with fruits, some resinous hops and some malts and nuts. Mild biscuits and grapefruits on the finish. Quite smooth, almost creamy, malty palate with soft carbonation. I usually dont like malty IPAs that much but this is quite good.
4315

[19-OCT-2013] Draught at EurHop Beer Festival (EBF) 2013 in Rome. Pours orange to red with a beige head, aroma of caramel, dark bread, sweet and pretty unpleasant, flavor is bitter with dark bread and some sweetness, medium bodied

Bottle: Served in a Chouffe glass:
Medium sized beige foamy head on top of a deep dark red ish brown colored beer.
Aroma is a sublime mix of hops, hop fruits, more hop fruits, some hop flowers, hoppy herbs, aaesome fruity! Great...
Flavours of hop fruits, hop flowers, hop bitters, hop herbs, tea herbs, some cream some malts and a nice hoppy sprinkle with a yeasty haziness...
Aftertaste is a mix of hop fruits, hop herbs, hop bitters, hops snd flowers...
Low carbo, creamy mouthfeel, medium to fuller bodied and a creamy texture. Hehe... Great stuff!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Bottled. Deep Dark amber coloured. Dense beige head. Aroma. Quite bready and caramelly. Some flowers and dried fruits. Flavour. Dried fruits, caramel, flowers, citrus. Medium bodied. Ends light bitter, light citric and Dry.

[10/19/13] Draught at Eurhop Beer Festival 2013 in Rome. Hazy dark amber with a beige head. Aroma of malt, a bit toasty, and piney hops. Flavor has a bit of sweet malt and quite a bit of piney and green hops with moderate bitterness. Medium-bodied.

UPDATED: OCT 26, 2013 33 cl. bottle @ home split by 2. Procured from De Hopduvel in Gent. Purchased upon recommendation of BoBoChamp. Pours a reddish / Bordeaux hued wood brown with quickly gone dark tanned head. Nose is pine resin sap, cocoa & dark fruits touch sweetish brown sugar. Taste is bitter pine, bark, dark fruits, sap, faint Shiitake (in a good way, I like Shiitake), cocoa, serious dash of cocoa powder, ground-like sweeter malts, bitter bark & pine finish, sap, Touch grainy body. Interesting blend. Nice brew.

2013-10-20. Mahogany red brown body with small frothy tan head. 3+ Green leafy hop aroma, mild fruit character. 7+ Flavour is moderately bitter throughout, fruity hops with muted citrus notes and mild English malt base. Average bodied palate, light carbonation. Enjoyable. Session 3, Cask Days 2013, Toronto

UPDATED: OCT 27, 2013 On tap at Cardinal. Copper colored, good foam. High intensity hops, also fruits, barrel aromas- some malt & caramel. Medium body & complexity. Solid bitterness. Very enjoyable

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours cloudy dark red. Nice smell on this. Sweet malt and caramel with some tangerine citrus. Caramelized malt makes a good backbone. Finishes a little bitter and a little sweet in good balance. Decent on palate. Cask Days 2013.

cask days 2013.
Dark for an ipa, quite red, a little hazy, small off white head. Good solid citrus aroma, some solid bittering, with a pleasant dose of biscuity hops. Another solid session ale.
Very dark red colour and very good. Cask Days 2013. Good drinkability and well balanced. A highlight of the day.
33cl, new exclusive English brew Anno 2013, from De Hopduvel Gent, complex brew, malty/sweet and slightly fruity/bitter, easy to drink, balanced, hazy, small head, good brew, yet expensive
