Thick creamy off white head. Clear deep amber pour. Nice bitterness. Another lovely Siren brew.

.5l on tap @ Vihreä Haltiatar 
Pours nice clear cherrywood red with medium head. Aroma is nice roasted malts, hops, red berries, fruity. Flavor is bread, roasted malts, hops, fruits. Nice hopsy palate. Bites nicely. Swell!

UPDATED: NOV 21, 2013 Draught @ Malja, Kuopio

Pours dark brownish red with a small bubbly head. Aroma of berries, fruits, hops and mild tartness. Taste is sweetish, malty and fruity with hints of berries and lactic tartness. Re-rated on 21.11.2013. 330ml bottle from Bierkompass. A much more balanced and tastier, malty amber ale with a touch of biscuity and nutty notes and hoppiness. Quite balanced.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines, Birmingham. Poured a murky dark brown with a frothy off white head and lots of lace. The aroma is rich red berry fruit. The flavour is medium bitter with a sweet, fruity, malt, liqourice palate. The consistency is rich and rather smooth. A super beer from Siren IMO.

Grifo. Vaso de Pinta en L´Espumossa (Barcelona). Brota con color marrón rojizo y tintes rubí a contraluz, con apariencia algo velada. Espuma marfileña y corona cremosa con bastante buena retención. Aromas de dulces maltas caramelo, bayas y frambuesas con trazos de chocolate fundido. Potente sabor malteado al primero sorbo. Cuerpo medio/pleno y carbonatación suave. En el intermedio, afloran los lúpulos que mezclados con notas de chocolate, permanecen en el dulce, pero no empalagoso, y malteado final redondeado por matices de resinas subyacentes. Sabrosa y de fácil asimilación.
On-tap. Pint glass @ L´Espumossa (Barcelona). Pours red Brown in color showing ruby tints to the light. Chill haze. Yellowish off-white froth & creamy crown. Fairly good retention. Sweet caramel malts, berries & fudge chocolate hues to the nose. Strong malty flavor at first sip. Medium to full body. Soft carbonation. In the middle, increasing hops from the back mixed with chocolate notes linger into a sweet malty finish rounded by underneath resiny hues. Flavorful & easy drinkable.

Copper/amber pour with off white head and lace. Aroma is resiny with some citrus. Flavor is sweet caramel malt with a nice resiny/citrus bitter finish. Medium full bodied with good carbonation. sweet start and finish on a pretty sweet beer

Bottle from Vino Wines. Murky amber/brown body with a large tan head. Powerful aroma of raisin, Tracker bar, blackcurrant and sticky mango. Initial flavour is sweet red fruit, then a whole loads of subtle flavours come in - earth, chocolate and grapefruit. Thin body with a very oily mouthfeel. Soft carbonation. A rich, distinctive IPA with an incredible aroma.

Cask @ The Gun IPA Festival, London. Pours dark brown with a small offwhite head. Aroma of malt, biscuit, mandarin, peach, citrus. Flavor is malt, light caramel, rich hops, peach, citrus, grapefruit. Medium body, soft carbonation, bitter finish. 150913

Cask at the Alehouse, Reading. Pours a striking ruby-brown with a loose beige head. Beautifully rich, smooth mouthfeel with a light sparkle on the tongue. Caramel, orange and a little chocolate up front before a lot of pine and some grapefruit bring in a great fresh hoppy taste. Candied pineapple followd along behind, with a bit of peach. Happy little burps of pine and pineapple with lingering fresh hops kept me smiling until bedtime. The pub had lots of other interesting beers on but this was so good that- unusually for me- I stuck with this one. Fabulous stuff, huge thanks to the brewer. Happy days!

On tap at Fermentoren, Copenhagen. Reddish brown colour, moderate off-white head. The brewerys description: "biscuit / crackers and burnt raisin malt base" and a "peach and grapefruit spark" seems quite appropriate both for aroma and flavour. Quite enjoyable, would buy again.
(Bottled) Dark brown -white foamy head. hoppy nose-rich hops. grapefruit textured hop accents ...woody ,bitter dry -attacking hops ..caramel sweet tones. Passable stuff.

Draft at Beer Temple. Pours clear red with a tan head. Aroma offer, cardboard, marmite, caramel, grass, grapefruit, light oatmeal. Flavour is moderate sweet and moderate to heavy bitter. Full bodied with soft carbonation.

I knew this was going to be good as soon as I poured it. Deep red lovely head and instantly glorious hop aroma. Nose dominated by the hops, but what hops! Resinous overripe fruit and that glorious cheese factor! Taste is wonderfully nuanced with dark fruits duking it out with sharp yellow fruit on a bed of gorgeous and subtle maltiness. Really great beer.

On tap at Beer Temple. Clear reddish amber-brown colour, off-white head. Aroma of citrussy hops, chocolate, hint of coffee, toast, hint of toffee. Flavour of toast, light-roasted malts, chocolate/cocoa, grapefruit, citrus, some tropical fruits, firm dry bitter finish with a little cocoa. Light-bodied. Really tasty mix of a best bitter, ipa, and mild ale imo.

Poured a slightly hazy reddish brown with a dense beige head. Aroma of muted floral hops, roast malt. Medium body, flavour of overly roasted malt, quite bitter, coffee grinds, some sweet berry fruit hidden. Lingering bitter, dry finish.
On tap at La bona pinta. Brown colour with off-white head. Citric and pine aroma, with some caramel. Malt, sweet caramel, pine taste, also citric. Medium body.

Draught @ Cerveseria La Resistència, Barcelona. Pours a cloudy bright golden colour with a white lacy foamy head. Aroma of strong floral hops, pale malts and mellow caramel notes. Flavour is really bitter with floral hops, pine, grapefruit, grass and some sweetness. Medium bodied, smooth mouthfeel and really soft carbonation. Finishes very bitter and rather dry. Some alcohol warmth in the finish as well. Great stuff.

Draught. Pours reddish brown in color with a small off-white head. Some piney notes, sweet ripe tropical fruits and light notes of chocolate. A bit of dark fruity sweetness mixed with grapefruit bitterness in taste. Nice one, works really well. Perhaps theres some slightly burnt notes too. Nice amber ale indeed.-- bb/wp
Cask-conditioned at the Famous Royal Naval Volunteer, Bristol 21/8/2013. Big citrus and pine notes, red berries, earthy, bready malts and a lingering dry finish. Enjoyable.

Tap at Olbaren. Medium to dark brown withorange tints and a huge, fine, foamy, chocolate milkshake head. Very malty caramel and chocolate nose with huge, grassy, dirty hops. Smells like a hoppy brown ale. Interesting, odd flavors: grass and earth, caramel, chocolate, pine, citrus, sweat, minerals. Not an IPA in my book. Citrusy, grassy finish is a bit harsh in a herbal way, though not so bitter. Interesting. Not great, but decent.
Draft at LCBF. Pours clear amber. Aroma is caramel, dark ripe fruits, raisin and grass. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter. Thick texture, a bit oily. Full bodied with average carbonation.

Draught at Brewdog, Stockholm.  Cloudy mahogany colour, creamy head. Aroma of tar, lingonberry and grapefruit. Sweet with medium body and rounded mouthfeel. Heavy caramel, red berries. Mid bitter finish. Mostly bold and heavy.

Tap @ C4. Clear mahogany body with a medium offwhite head. Aroma is malt, caramel, chocolate notes, hops. Flavour is hops, malt, caramel, sweet aftertaste. Nice.
Tap @ C4, Odense. Pours hazy amber small creamy head. Rarely had a beer This malty that I Liked This much. Sweet caramel, biscuit, bread and fresh hops. Smooth and soft. Hoppy end.

Reddy brown, thick tan head, aroma of bread, grapefruit and caramel. The flavour is slightly more one dimensional but still lovely. The flavour is a big hit but gentle all the same. Smooth as silk. A great beer.

On tap at Christian Firtal. Amber with a creamy and lasting, off-white head. Juicy and fruity hop aroma of orange, tangerine and apricot, with malty notes of toffee and creme brullee. Sweetish malty flavour with lots of fruity hop character and a very bitter finish
Srong malty backbone that feeds through the hops quite brilliantly. Well done Siren, top work. Dark amber almost red pour.

No head, beige or otherwise Danyul, but thats probably how Im pouring or down to the mind bending temperatures. Beautiful deep mohagany appearance and a malty centrepiece. Fugazi never have a setlist, they just make it up as they go along. Incredible. Song to the Siren. Pipe.
Dark amber brown smooth light brown head. Aroma is bitter malty, slightly sweet gentle quite bitter hops. Flavor is malty bitter hoppy dry large body yet quite dry.
330ml bottle. Pours a dark reddy Brown with a medium, frothy head. Aroma is piney hops and toffee. Taste is tangerine jelly to start. Icing sugar and piney hop finish.

On tap (Keg) at Lovinbonds, Friday 19.07.13 Thank you to Jeff for the free generous sized taster.   Red/amber in colour with a large light beige head. Aroma seemed to be mostly citrus with a good blast of grapefruit, nice soft carbonation, really easy drinking beer. Good balance of sweet and bitter, hoppy burps aplenty after I left here. Really liked this beer. Jeff said that Ryan hasnt got a tap room yet which is a shame as the camper could quite easily be Finchampstead bound. Ive had a few Siren beers but been a bit lazy rating over the last 6 months, need to start searching out with more regularity on the basis of this beer.  A8 A4 T8 P4 Ov16 4.0

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines, Birmingham. Beautiful colour, with a very attractive beige head which sticks and lasts. Mouthfeel is so lustrous - it feel like my tongue is going to sleep in a lovely duvet. Its tastes lovely also - breaded nutty raisins and tangy red orange which has been jumped on. Niceee.

14/07/2013 Ma che siete venuti a fà (tap). Rossiccia, abbastanza torbida, schiuma bianco sporca con venature maionese, leggera e non molto persistente. Al naso sentori di malto, caramello, con note agrumate e di resina intense. In bocca è un succo di luppolo, la base di malto cè, evidente, ma non è eccessiva, il finale è amaro, non molto secco. Corpo medio, carbonazione leggera. Più che IPA direi amber ale. Discreta. nulla più.

Keg in Craft Beer Co Brixton. Colour is clear dark reddish brown, thin white bubbly head. Nose is delicious. Pine hope, grapefruit, cutrous hop, but with a malty undercurrent of toasty grain and chocolate. Taste is floral, pine hop, grapefruit citrous with choclalte and toasty malt. Very good beer.
Cask at CASK Pub, Pimlico, London. Interesting red body compared to most amber IPAs. Almost get the suggestion of cherries and chocolate coming through the bitter hops. Well balanced. Tasty.

Cask @ CBC 2013. Pours a dark amber color with a small off-white head. has a fruity malty hoppy caramel aroma. Fruity malty hoppy bitter grapefruit flavor with hints of caramel. Has a fruity malty hoppy bitter grapefruit finish.

Draught, 5.8%. Good caramelly hoppiness in the aroma. Cloudy brown colour. OK tan head. The flavour seems hoppy at first with caramel and resin, but after a while it turns out that it is really roasted and bready. Even later there is some fruity hop as well. Has a distinct bitterness, clean and a little astringent.
Cask at CBC Islington;  red/brown pour with foamy beige head, piney hop aroma, hoppy taste with grapefruit, pineapple a hint of spice.

Tap at CBC Islington. Pours ruby red with a small, firm beige head. Great lacing left . Nose is piney american hops with some heavy sticky sweetness about it. Touch of grapefruit in there. Taste shwocases some dried fruits - peach, apricot. Quite piney and earthy. Very sticky sweet with mild bitterness on the finish. Solid

Cask at the Rose & Crown, Sandhurst. Deep reddish chestnut with a scummy head, and an attractive cherry red gleam in the sunlight; piney, resinous, American hop aroma; grainy body with some sharp hops from the start; then a long dry, chewy, finish with green birch wood and perhaps a touch of grapefruit. A great beer, but rather flat and dull looking - perhaps an example of one of those cask beers thats better from the keg than from the cask.

Tap @ Mikkeller and Friends, Cph. Pours deep red black with a small, staying, creamy, beige head. Aroma has dark chocolate, coffee, light citrus. Medium to low carbonation, fine dry and lovely creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has velvety chocolate, firm citrussy hops, peach, light grapefruit, soft caramel. Exquisite and very well balanced. Is Ryan the single most talented brewer alive?

Draught @ CBC 2013. Pours clear dark red with a lasting and good lacing creamy beige medium head. Aroma is caramel, raisin, grapefruit, flowery  and peach. Taste is medium sweet and bitter. Body is medium, texture is soft/smooth, carbonation is soft. Finis is balanced. Very nice indeed and very well executed.

Cask @ cask. Dark deep red colour with off white head, not much visible carbonation. Nice aroma - sweet candy fruit, malty notes, with some hops. Coffee and a little choc. A litter watery on palate, no carbonation. Flavour is bitter slight coffee, some grapefruit and more bitterness on finish. Not as full or complex as I thought it might be but OK.

CBC. Hazy dark brown with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and moderate hoppy - citrus. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 040513
Cask @ CBC. Dark brown with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, caramel, hop and grapefruit. Flavour is malt, caramel, hops, grapefruit, medium bitter, little sweet and a little toasted.

Deep rich ruby red. Thick creamy persistent head. Twiggy a little weed in a good way. Like an Amsterdam cafe. Flavour is well balanced nice piny citrus hop. Medium dry. Medium duration. A little metal.

Sample at CBC 2013, Saturday.

Slightly hazy amber with a small head. Grape, toffee, malt and some hops. Rather sweet, descent stuff.

Draught at CBC 2013, cons 2013-05-04 Cophenhagen 
AR: tropical fruits, roasted malt
AP: frothy high head

Clear brown colour with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of hops, malt, caramel, fruit and spicy notes.
Fat på CBC 2013. Smak och doft av humle, malt med smak av Läkerol Original. Fadd med tydlig beska.

Fat på CBC 2013. En söt och lite annorlunda IPA. Karamellkok, söta russin och läkerol orginal i den matsöta kropp. Fruktig persika och rejäl grapebeska. Roligt att det fortfarande går att göra en IPA med ny profil.

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2014 Re-rate February 5th 2014. bottle @ home. Clear dark red color, medium sized off-white to beige head that lasts for a decent while. Smell and taste malts, hops, some fruityness, decently bitter. Clear amber - red color, small to average sized, fair lacing, mostly diminishing off-white to beige head. Smell lightly malts, flowers, perfume, lightly citrus. Taste malts, lightly sweet, lightly bitter, lightly fruity. A bit weak flavorwise imo. Low body, soft carbonation.

Sampled cask at CBC, blue session, Saturday afternoon May 4, 2013.Clear dark brown color, brown head. Malty, hoppy, resin taste. Bitter in a good way aftertaste. Smooth velvet mouthfeel, low bitterness. Sweet, hop bag scent.
Draught at CBC 2013. Brown, beige head. Piney, tropical fruit aroma, some toasted aromas. Medium bodied, medium carbonation. Dry with medium bitterness.

Draught at CBC 2013. Dark amber/brown beer with a nice beige head. Hoppy fruity aroma, chocolate, caramel, floral, citrus, some raisins. Hoppy fruity flavor, caramel, chocolate, citrus, grapefruit notes, some cocoa.

Cask. Hazy deep red liquid with medium off-white head. Aroma of citrus, weed, pine, lemon grass, biscuit and bread. Taste is dry and light to medium bitter with notes of citrus, biscuit and lemon grass. Medium bodied with low carbonation.

(Cask at King William IV, Leyton, London, 25 Apr 2013) Ruby red colour with foamy, beige head. Malty, fruity nose with caramel, citrus and blood orange. Malty, fruity taste with notes of caramel, blood orange, grapefruit, a touch of resin and a generous citric, resinous bitterness in the finish. Medium body, with balanced sweetness. Nice one.

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2013 Lovely smell, just like a normal ipa with some malt overtones. Complex - strong bitter hops with a touch of raspberry and biscuit underneath. Sustained bitterness in the aftertaste, well judged. Some yeast sediment.
Draught at Mikkeller & Friends. Clear dark brown - offwhite head. Ok fresh hoppy. Roasted malty. Sweet malty notes. Grassy. Cocoa. Resin. Light tobacco. Peppery. Nice.

(on tap @ Mikkeller & Friends) I tried catching this at the CBC in Leather Lane last week but they were all sold out after the release party a few weeks ago and seemingly hadn't received any more. This one pours a semi-clear dark copper with little head and lace. Glass and serving do not lend themselves well to an attenpt at regenerating the head. Aroma is hoppy with notes of tropical fruits and sodapop. Oily texture, soft carbonation, full body with a lingering, moderately bitter finish. Flavour brings a more earthy, leafy, resiny bitterness to complement the more fruity nose. Interesting, pleasant and making you want to explore further.
A dark and heavy beer again. And again one that you cant drink 10 in a row. Have I ever been able to do that?
Tap @ Mikkeller, Stefansgade. Nice head with good duration. Color is dark brown. Aroma and taste are rich malt, light bitter hops, little caramel, pine and is full bodied.

From tap at Mikkeller & Friends. Pours hazy dark brown to black with a small white head. Fruity, grapefruity and light toasted malty. Smooth fruity, toasted malty and mild bitter. Crisp hoppy and dark roasted malty finish.

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2014 Tap. Dark chestnut brown with a small off white head. Aroma is caramel, peach, mango, light citrus, raisins. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter. Medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation. Medium bitter fruity finish. Malty sweet, but at bit thin.

Draft at Mikkeller and Friends.
Clear red-brown coloured with a small off-white head.
Sweet and fruity aroma of caramel, hops, pine needles and hay.
Fruity flavour of hops, caramel, pine needles and grass.
Dry hoppy finish.

Draft. A reed beer with a beige head. The aroma has notes of spicy hops, malt, caramel, and grapefruits. The flavor is sweet with notes of caramel, hops, spices, malt, and grapefruits, leading to a bitter finish. Nice hop selection.

Keg at CBC, Clerkenwell. This red IPA is the darkest red imaginable with a yellowish head on top. Fruity hops and caramel in the aroma are shadowed by hints of smoke and campfire. Very nice mouthfeel with a taste falling somewhere between a red and black IPA. First offering Ive had from them and based on this Ill have to try more.

[keg at the Holyrood 9A, Edinburgh] Brownish pour, some highlights, small white head. Spritzy nose of grapefruit, lemon and pine resin. Quite earthy on the taste, before the citrus elements come out  gets extremely fruity and very bitter. Really nice [29032013]
Cask @ Inn Deep. Dark Red brown colour, good head. Mild fruity biscuit hop aroma. Dry raisin flavour, bitter aftertaste. More a premium bitter than an IPA.

Keg at brewdog. Dark brown and up as 6.5%. aroma of treacle, toffee, milk chocolate and pine and grapefruit, some dark fruits. Tate of dark fruits, toffee, molasses, citrus, milk chocolate in the finish. Tad thin. Think this might be mislabeled....decent but not an ipa. Brown ale or black ipa
Phenomenal beer, warm malty/hop aroma, tastes slightly watery and hoppy, dryish finish. Love it!

Sampled on both cask and keg at Craft Beer Co EC1- 9 March 2013. Great stuff with the cask vers my personal fave. Look forward to trying it again.

text: Cask at the Cask Pub and Kitchen. Pours a deep brown colour with a hint of red, aroma is hoppy and hints of citrus fruits, taste is hoppy and fruity with a dry bitter finish.

Cask at Craft, Islington, London. A deep red/amber coloured pour with a medium fluffy off white head on top. Hoppy, pine, grapefruit aroma. Tastes hoppy, grapefruit, tropical fruit, caramel, malty, slight sweetness. Incredibly moreish, the best one Ive had from Siren to date.

Cask at Craft Clerkenwell. it pours deep red with a medium beige head. The nose is pungently hoppy, earth, pine, fruity, jam, light toffee and varnish. The taste is resinous, bitter pine, nice bitterness, earth, leaf, red berry, dark fruit, redcurrant, grapefruit, light tang and varnish with a bitter finish. Medium body and soft carbonation. Well-rounded and delicious. Well done!
keg at brewdog ... deeo brown ... soft toffee malt dark fruit ... sweet toffee roast ....bittee fruit ... soft chocolate

9th March 2013Craft Islington. Keg. Rich deep amber coloured beer. Little pale tan head. Palate is light and crisp. Fresh hop nose, nice. Mild minerals. Lovely fruit salad hops, tropical fruits and even a trace of forest fruits - tastes like Galaxy but less bitter. But no, wrong again - Ryan said these were also US hops. Finishes crisp. Really nice fruity beer!

Clear reddish amber with a beige head that retains well.
Nose is hops, orange, grapefruit, pine.
Taste comprises hops, tropical fruit notes, grapefruit, juicy orange, pine, sugars, mango, touch of caramel.
Medium bodied, soft carbonation, dryish in the finish with some hop bitterness.
Absolute cracker this one!!!

text: Keg and cask at CBC Clerkenwell, London. I will rate keg version as ut wax my favourite. It pours a deep dark ruby colour, almost red. Tanned small head that vanishes quickly. Aroma is sweet base and loads of citrusy piney hops on top. Taste is similar with malt, toffee, lemon zest and pineapple. Overall, not entirely my style but quite tasty.

Keg and cask at craft islington, 13 th march 13. This is a great red ale, liked this on both cask and keg, both had positives, more carbonation on keg, as expected, but the cask was my preferred, great beer

Keg @ CPK. The pours a dead still reddish brown. No head whatsoever. The nose is rich red berry, fruit compote. Nice sweet malts, some toffee, a bit of spruce and peppery hop. The taste is wonderfully balanced strawberry jam and sprucy, resinous hop bitterness. Inviting, sweet flavors. The mouthfeels a bit still and lethargic. This is definitely a bit undercarbonated. Overall, a really tasty beer thats nearly there. Looking forward to trying the next batch.
